channel.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
channel.description:
When I go off to University I'm going to replace my laptop.
I have a year but I'm going to discuss this now because:
1) I'm bored. 2) I need a year to save up :D
Just wondering what are peoples opinion on laptop manufacturers.
I build desktops often but when it comes to notebooks I'm not at all well up.
Personally I think Acer and Asus seems to look pretty awesome at the moment.
If anyone suggests a mac - expect to be hit by a banhammer.

item.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

acer is shit, donotwant
get a toshiba or a hp, they are very decent

Read full topic

item.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

I have windows 3.1 on one of my old desktops. My parents got it before I was born, and it came out before windows so they had to have it installed afterwards. It’s pretty good, and it can run dialup at least. [Offtopic, but the old AOLs are fun - back when I used to have dialup, I used a copy of AOL 3.0 I found around the house and installed it on my w95 compaq laptop, it’s funny how many features they’ve cut out from the version I used to use on my normal computer]

Read full topic

item.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
item.dc:creator: @cooper cooper
item.description:
@cooper wrote:

Hp is great.

Greeny, If you have the money, I would recommend an OQO Model 02, I have one, and it’s amazingly useful - I can take it everywhere I need to, you can get internet anywhere [I didn’t select that option], and it doubles as a tablet as well. The keyboard and screen size may seem a bit hard to use, but once you get it, you’ll find it’s actually very easy to use, and I can type just as fast on it as most people do on normal keyboards. It weighs about one pound without the battery, and a bit more with it. The double capacity battery is a great combination with the stronghold case.

Read full topic

item.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Greeny, if I were you I’d either go with an HP Tablet (come w/ fingerprint scanner) or just an HP laptop. My school has both, but the Tablet is about $1000 more expensive than the normal laptop so my school is planning on returning them.

This is my review on the HP Tablet:

  • Battery life goes down about an hour every year, thats nothing to worry about if you get the extended battery. (makes about 12 hrs of power in the beginning)
  • Speed stays the same no matter what (quick)
  • 1 year warranty
  • Keyboard keys can be removed and put back
  • Comes with all the extra features of tablets
    • Handwriting to text converting
    • Sticky notes (a program that is like a reminder), you can write a note and set what time the computer should remind you
    • Screen can turn 180 degrees and be laid down to write on more easier
    • Writing with a tablet pen
  • And lastly, its lightweight (w/o the extended battery)

Read full topic

item.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Thanks for the inputs.

item.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

I’ve had several acers over the past years.

I only had to send it in once and that was back in the rs days when I got pked and slammed my keyboard and a few letters broke.

I would undoubtedly choose acer.

Read full topic

item.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I’ve had this Dell laptop for over a year now, and believe it or not, the only time I needed to send it back was when I fucked up the motherboard. Flashing the bios is a thing best done when you have no possibility of tripping over the power cable.

Other than that, it was reasonably priced(with the standard 90 day warranty, ofc) at the time and is still standing strong today.

Read full topic

item.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

My current one is a compaq packard bell mix up. It’s run great for about 3 years.

The new Acers look sweet as fuck, they have a fingerprint scanner! /me loves gimicks

Anyway I have a year to fuck around and find one.

In case anyone wondered I’m going to basically be getting as high spec as possible for <£1000 which is around 2000$. Hopefully in around a year that’ll be something packing a shit ton of power.

Read full topic

item.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Just to go against the crowd, cuz that’s how I roll, I’m typing this post on an Acer that is getting on in years - I don’t treat my computers particularly well nomsain, but I’ve never had a problem with it.

touch wood

Read full topic

Dell = Hard disks always die and batteries crap.
Compaq = if you pull the keyboard out, its fucked
HP = comes fast, gets slow after a week
Asus = Haven’t seen anything bad about these
Toshiba = Bios is a bitch if you want to change settings
IBM = ugly as hell

item.title: Top Laptop Manufacturer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I love my Asus, it’s the best laptop I’ve ever seen/used.

A lot of my family have Acer laptops, one of them got sent back 3 times, then died shortly after the 1 year warranty ended. The others all still work, but have 5-10 minutes of battery life after being used for 6 months or so. I have always liked acer, and they are good for the money just recently I have had bad experiences with them.

Read full topic
